title: JSON Schema for service parameters used in BTPSA
description: Provide service parameters in usecase.json files of BTPSA

myemail.description: Email address you use to access your SAP BTP account
myemail.title: Your email address

loginmethod.title: login method to SAP BTP
loginmethod.description: if set to sso, you'll need to open a link provided in a browser to login. Set to basicAuthentication (default) the script will ask if you want to provide username and password. If set to **envVariables** you need to provide the email address and password by setting the environment variable **BTPSA_PARAM_MYEMAIL** and **BTPSA_PARAM_MYPASSWORD**. In addition you can as well provide the global account through the environment variable **BTPSA_PARAM_GLOBALACCOUNT**.

region.description: region of the BTP sub account that should be used for the use case
region.title: region for the subaccount

org.description: org name of the CF environment for use case
org.title: org name of the CF environment for use case

orgid.description: org id of the CF environment for use case
orgid.title: org id of the CF environment for use case

iashost.description: IAS host for your SAP BTP sub account
iashost.title: IAS host for your SAP BTP sub account

suffixinstancename.description: suffix attached to each service instance created
suffixinstancename.title: suffix attached to each service instance created

fallbackserviceplan.description: if defined, the tool will use the defined name as fallback service plan, if the plan defined in the use case is not supported
fallbackserviceplan.title: if defined, the tool will use the defined name as fallback service plan, if the plan defined in the use case is not supported

repeatstatusrequest.description: time in seconds to wait after requesting status info (pulling)
repeatstatusrequest.title: time in seconds to wait after requesting status info (pulling)

repeatstatustimeout.description: timeout in seconds after which requests should be stopped
repeatstatustimeout.title: timeout in seconds after which requests should be stopped

waitForKymaEnvironmentCreation.description: Should the tool wait for the creation of the Kyma environment
waitForKymaEnvironmentCreation.title: Should the tool wait for the creation of the Kyma environment

timeoutLimitForKymaCreationInMinutes.description: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be created
timeoutLimitForKymaCreationInMinutes.title: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be created

pollingIntervalForKymaCreationInMinutes.description: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be created
pollingIntervalForKymaCreationInMinutes.title: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be created

timeoutLimitForKymaDeprovisioningInMinut.description: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted
timeoutLimitForKymaDeprovisioningInMinut.title: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted

pollingIntervalForKymaDeprovisioningInMi.description: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted
pollingIntervalForKymaDeprovisioningInMi.title: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted

parameterfile.description: file to deliver all parameters within a single json file
parameterfile.title: file to deliver all parameters within a single json file

logcommands.description: if set to True, the script will log all commands sent to the SAP BTP account. If set to False it won't
logcommands.title: if set to True, the script will log all commands sent to the SAP BTP account. If set to False it won't

pruneusecase.description: if set to True: deletes all assets of a usecase based on the collected info in the metadatafile. No confirmation message. USE WITH CARE!!!
pruneusecase.title: if set to True: deletes all assets of a usecase based on the collected info in the metadatafile. No confirmation message. USE WITH CARE!!!

prunesubaccount.description: if set to True: same like -pruneusecase, but on-top deletes the subaccount. USE WITH CARE!!!
prunesubaccount.title: if set to True: same like -pruneusecase, but on-top deletes the subaccount. USE WITH CARE!!!

mypassword.description: provide your BTP password via the command line. USE WITH CARE!!!
mypassword.title: provide your BTP password via the command line. USE WITH CARE!!!

cfcliapihostregion.description: host region for the Cloud Foundry CLI calls
cfcliapihostregion.title: host region for the Cloud Foundry CLI calls

btpcliapihostregion.description: host region for the BTP CLI calls
btpcliapihostregion.title: host region for the BTP CLI calls

envvariables.description: list of environment variables on OS level to be used within commands defined in the `executeBeforeAccountSetup` and `executeAfterAccountSetup`.
envvariables.title: list of environment variables on OS level to be used within commands defined in the `executeBeforeAccountSetup` and `executeAfterAccountSetup`.

myusergroups.description: list of user groups to be used in btpsa
myusergroups.title: list of user groups to be used in btpsa
